definition: Qianlong Emperor (1711-1799), sixth Qing emperor, princely title 寶親王|宝亲王[Bao3 Qin1 wang2], personal name 弘曆|弘历[Hong2 li4], reigned 1735-1799
variant of 乾[qian2]
one of the Eight Trigrams 八卦[ba1 gua4], symbolizing heaven/male principle/☰/ancient Chinese compass point: 315° (northwest)
surname Qian
old variant of 乾[qian2]
sound of drums
surname Long/short for 吉隆坡[Ji2 long2 po1], Kuala Lumpur
grand/intense/prosperous/to swell/to bulge

sentences.english: Qianlong was the emperor of Qing dynasty.
From a technical point of view JingDeZhen reached its highest level of achievement in the Qianlong reign.
sentences.chinese: 乾隆朝景德镇工艺瓷的制作达到了历史上的最高水平。

sentences.english: A large Jade boulder flanked by vessels from the Qianlong Garden, in the middle of the 180-acre Forbidden City in Beijing, is in the exhibit.
sentences.chinese: 展出中一块巨大的绿玉石和两件乾隆时期的容器。

sentences.english: Tea was 18th century Chinese Emperor Chien Lung's favorite drink.
sentences.chinese: 茶是18世纪时的中国皇帝乾隆喜爱的饮料。

sentences.english: He was also a famous book collector and epigrapher in Shantong area during Qian Long period.
sentences.chinese: 他也是乾隆朝山东著名的藏书家及金石学家。

sentences.english: In the meanwhile, they also point out and criticize Qianlong's arbitrary decisions and peremptory actions.
sentences.chinese: 与此同时，他们也指斥了乾隆的专横独断等行为。

sentences.english: 'Portrait of the Qianlong Emperor,' ink and colors on silk, is part of the visiting exhibit.
Emperor Qianlong visited the Pomegranate Garden, paying court to Pomegranate Blossom Fairy.
sentences.chinese: 乾隆微服私访石榴园，向榴花仙女求爱。

sentences.english: Qianlong calm thinking after forgive the little swallow and recognize the crape myrtle.
sentences.chinese: 乾隆冷静思量之后原谅了小燕子并认了紫薇。

sentences.english: This mound was also known as the "Horse-Riding Platform, " since Emperor Qianlong used to ride his horse here.
sentences.chinese: 此山曾是乾隆帝跑马登山处，俗称转马台。

sentences.english: During Qing Emperor QianLong's reign it was reconstructed again in 1751.
sentences.chinese: 在1751年清朝乾隆年间又再次重修了。

sentences.english: Trick defeat rebellion thing, Shih-hsiang, officials should pay attention to the summer, stop by Emperor Qianlong.
sentences.chinese: 谋反计划败事，官员们要抓施襄夏，被乾隆克制。

sentences.english: Being rapt in writing was something prehistorical for me till then.
sentences.chinese: 醉心写作已成为乾隆年间的事了。

sentences.english: In the Qianlong period of Qing dynasty Chinese ink sticks collected in the imperial court were sifted on the large scale.
sentences.chinese: 乾隆时期，对宫廷内藏墨进行了大规模地整理。

sentences.english: Qing Emperor Qianlong period, Shangdang Bangzi is a sophisticated drama.
sentences.chinese: 清乾隆时期，上党梆子已是一个成熟剧种。

sentences.english: Chien Lung Tung Pao is the most common standard cash in the history of the Chinese coinage.
sentences.chinese: 在中国方孔钱中，我相信清代的乾隆通宝是最常见的。

definition: Yongzheng, reign name of Qing emperor (1722-1735)
Kangxi, title of the reign (1661-1722) of the Kangxi Emperor 聖祖|圣祖[Sheng4 zu3]
Jiaqing Emperor (1760-1820), seventh Qing emperor, personal name 顒琰|颙琰[Yong2 yan3], reigned 1796-1820
Heshen (1746-1799), Manchu official of the Qing Dynasty who openly practiced various forms of corruption on a grand scale
reign name of second Qing emperor (1644-1662)
Ch'ing or Qing dynasty (1644-1911)
Daoguang Emperor
reign name of Qing emperor (1850-1861)/Xianfeng county in Enshi Tujia and Miao autonomous prefecture 恩施土家族苗族自治州[En1 shi1 Tu3 jia1 zu2 Miao2 zu2 zi4 zhi4 zhou1], Hubei
Empress Dowager Cixi or Ts'u Hsi (reigned 1861-1908)
Empress Dowager Cixi or Ts'u Hsi (1835-1908), regent 1861-1908
reign name of Qing emperor (1861-1875)
Fulin Emperor Shunzhi (1638-1662), second Qing emperor, reigned 1644-1662
reign name of Ming emperor (1573-1619)
reign name of penultimate Qing emperor Guangxu or Guang-hsu (1875-1908)

Zhang Tingyu (1672-1755), Qing politician, senior minister to three successive emperors, oversaw compilation of History of the Ming Dynasty 明史[Ming2 shi3] and the Kangxi Dictionary 康熙字典[Kang1 xi1 Zi4 dian3]
emperor/CL:個|个[ge4]
